items.name: Accessibility.Requirement
items.summary:
A requirement defining how the visual presentation of text achieves
a minimum contrast ratio to pass the accessibility specification -
https://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#visual-audio-contrast-contrast

syntax.content: public enum Requirement

items.name: Minimum
items.summary:
The visual presentation of text has a contrast ratio of at least
4.5:1 (Level AA) -
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?versions=2.0#qr-visual-audio-contrast-contrast

syntax.content: Minimum = 0

items.name: MinimumLargeText
items.summary:
The visual presentation of large text has a contrast ratio of at
least 3:1 (Level AA) -
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?versions=2.0#qr-visual-audio-contrast-contrast

syntax.content: MinimumLargeText = 1

items.name: Enhanced
items.summary:
The visual presentation of text has a contrast ratio of at least
7:1 (Level AAA) -
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?versions=2.0#qr-visual-audio-contrast7

syntax.content: Enhanced = 2

items.name: EnhancedLargeText
items.summary:
The visual presentation of large text has a contrast ratio of at
least 4.5:1 (Level AAA) -
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?versions=2.0#qr-visual-audio-contrast7

syntax.content: EnhancedLargeText = 3

items.name: Accessibility
items.summary: Functions for testing color accessibility requirements.

syntax.content: public static class Accessibility

items.name: MinimumContrastRatio(Accessibility.Requirement)
items.summary:
Returns the minimum contrast ratio needed to pass compliance of a
given accessibility requirement.

syntax.content: public static float MinimumContrastRatio(this Accessibility.Requirement requirement)

parameters.description: The requirement to check.

return.description: The minimum contrast ratio needed to pass the requirement.

items.name: IsCompliant(Accessibility.Requirement, Color, Color)
items.summary:
Determines if the contrast between a foreground color and a
background color is compliant to the accessibility requirement.

syntax.content: public static bool IsCompliant(this Accessibility.Requirement requirement, Color foreground, Color background)

parameters.description: The requirement to check.
The foreground color.
The background color.

return.description: True if the contrast is compliant, false otherwise.

items.name: IsCompliant(Color, Color, Accessibility.Requirement)
items.summary:
Determines if the contrast between the foreground color and a
background color is compliant to a given accessibility requirement.

syntax.content: public static bool IsCompliant(this Color foreground, Color background, Accessibility.Requirement requirement)

parameters.description: The foreground color.
The background color.
The requirement to check.

return.description: True if the contrast is compliant, false otherwise.

items.name: Arithmetic
items.summary: Functions for adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing colors.

syntax.content: public static class Arithmetic

items.name: Add(ref Color, Color, Boolean)
items.summary:
Adds the components of another color to the current color. Clamps
the values in the range [0..1].

syntax.content: public static void Add(this ref Color color, Color other, bool addAlpha = true)

parameters.description: The color being added to.
The color to add.
True to add the alpha components, otherwise it is left unmodified.

items.summary:
Returns the result of adding the components of another color to the
current color. Clamps the values in the range [0..1].

parameters.description: The color being added to.
The color to add.
True to add the alpha components, otherwise it is left unmodified.

return.description: The new color with the added components.

Subtracts the components of another color from the current color.

syntax.content: public static void Subtract(this ref Color color, Color other, bool subtractAlpha = true)

True to subtract the alpha components, otherwise it is left unmodified.

True to subtract the alpha components, otherwise it is left unmodified.

return.description: The new color with the subtracted components.

True to multiply the alpha components, otherwise it is left unmodified.

items.name: ColorVision
items.summary: A type of color vision.

syntax.content: public enum ColorVision

items.name: Normal
items.summary: Normal color vision.

syntax.content: Normal = 0

items.name: Protanopia
items.summary:
Protanopia is a blindness to red, a state in which the red cones are
absent.

syntax.content: Protanopia = 1

items.name: Protanomaly
items.summary:
Protanomaly is a reduced sensitivity to red, a result of
functionally limited red cones.

syntax.content: Protanomaly = 2

items.name: Deuteranopia
items.summary:
Deuteranopia is a blindness to green, a state in which the green
cones are absent.

syntax.content: Deuteranopia = 3

items.name: Deuteranomaly
items.summary:
Deuteranomaly is a reduced sensitivity to green, a result of
functionally limited green cones.

syntax.content: Deuteranomaly = 4

items.name: Tritanopia
items.summary:
Tritanopia is a blindness to blue, a state in which the blue cones
are absent.

syntax.content: Tritanopia = 5

items.name: Tritanomaly
items.summary:
Tritanomaly is a reduced sensitivity to blue, a result of
functionally limited blue cones.

syntax.content: Tritanomaly = 6

items.name: Achromatopsia
items.summary:
Achromatopsia is a condition characterized by a total absense of
color vision.

syntax.content: Achromatopsia = 7

items.name: Achromatomaly
items.summary:
Achromatomaly is a condition characterized by a partial absense of
color vision.

syntax.content: Achromatomaly = 8

items.name: MixingModel
items.summary:
A model that describes how colors are mixed together to form all other
colors.

syntax.content: public enum MixingModel

items.name: Additive
items.summary:
A mixing model that leads to the RGB color model with primary colors
of red, green, and blue. The absence of color is black, and the
presence of all three primary colors is white. Colors are added
together to form white. Additive color mixing simulates light.

syntax.content: Additive = 0

items.name: Subtractive
items.summary:
A mixing model that leads to the CMYK color model with primary
colors of cyan, magenta, and yellow. The absence of color is white,
and the presence of all three primary colors is black. Colors are
subtracted to form black. Subtractive color mixing simulates print.

syntax.content: Subtractive = 1

items.name: Traditional
items.summary:
A mixing model that leads to the RYB color model with primary colors
of red, yellow, and blue. The absence of color is white, and the
presence of all three primary colors is black. Traditional color
mixing simulates paint.

syntax.content: Traditional = 2
